metadata.Title: CVE-2023-39194 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description: A flaw was found in the XFRM subsystem in the Linux kernel. The specificflaw exists within the processing of state filters, which can result in aread past the end of an allocated buffer. This flaw allows a localprivileged (CAP_NET_ADMIN) attacker to trigger an out-of-bounds read,potentially leading to an information disclosure.

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of standard support').
